alert.note: Alert for Lee; Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 6:44PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Lee and Owsley. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 641 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated scattered showers and thunderstorms still ongoing across portions of the advisory area. These will continue to provide a threat of minor flooding in low lying areas through 8 PM. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beattyville, Booneville, Levi, Pebworth, Scoville, Vincent, Turin, Ida May, Lower Buffalo, Endee, Delvinta, Corgleton, Travellers Rest, White Ash, Chestnut Gap, Caryton, Enoch, Belle Point, Major and Cressmont.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
